alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 7:54PM CST until March 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Newport affecting Jackson and Independence Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting Woodruff, Prairie and White Counties. White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. White River At Augusta affecting Woodruff and White Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Arkansas and Monroe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Newport. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, State Highway 14 between Newport and Oil Trough and State Highway 122 to Newark affected. Possible structural flooding along State Highway 14 in Independence County. Bateman Levee patrolling begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Saturday evening to a crest of 27.0 feet by Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date White River Newport 26.0 24.8 Sat 7 PM 27.0 26.8 26.2 27.0 6 PM 3/05 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
